skillTree.localised_description: Smaller than their powerful Bretonnian equivalents, barding protects Imperial warhorses from blows that would otherwise fell these proud beasts.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Considered spectres of death in many ancient tales, Carmine Dragons are sinister, clever and deadly. To some races, their appearance is an omen that presages disaster.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

skillTree.localised_description: When brought into contact with this jewel, weapons ignite with ice-cold blue flames that burn anything they touch.
This enchanted root from Athel Loren gifts the power of healing to whomsoever is holding it.
The Doomfire Ring, made from dark iron and flame rubies, contains a powerful spell that allows its bearer to cast fire upon their enemies.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Those who bear the Mark of Hysh are practitioners of the magical Lore of Light, and the bane of Chaos, for they are able to control and manipulate the White Wind of Magic.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Tell me dying one… are you afraid? I can assure you, you should be."

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: -25%
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Elspeth von Draken comes from an illustrious bloodline of magic-users blessed with increased sensitivity to the Winds of Magic.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lore of Death spells

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: She who has the ear of the Countess Emmanuelle von Liebwitz is a powerful person indeed…

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -15% for Gunnery units
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Parents warn their children about straying into the Gardens of Morr at nightfall, for that is where Elspeth's blackened tower stands, and her ethereal power is said to manifest.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: No one knows quite how long Elspeth has lived, or even if she lives at all anymore, but her name has been spoken of in hushed tones by at least three generations of Nulners.
Although a member of the hallowed Amethyst Order of Wizards, Elspeth is very much an outlier among her peers for her fierce independence and extensive knowledge of Shyish.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -6 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Winds of Magic cost: -9 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: Cloaked in the deathly energies of Shyish, Elspeth directs Dark Magic and gunpowder at the Empire's every enemy.

effects.description: Has access to the Imperial Gunnery School, enabling access to unique unit upgrades and special units

Ammunition: +5% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units

Double experience gain for Artillery and Gunnery units
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: A scythe made more of shadow than substance, this weapon, said to be of von Draken's own making, is attuned to the power of Shyish.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Death spells

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases when nearby allies or enemies cast spells.

item_set.name: Artefact Hoarder
item_set.description: All manner of useful magical artefacts have been stored by Elspeth over the many, many years she has wound her way through this troubled world.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +50%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

items.colour_text: A shroud of Shyish hangs over these sands of time, offering life with one hand while dealing death with the other.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.
